required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Intraocular Pressure and Optic Nerve Sheath Diameter Changes in Laparoscopic Cholecystectomies
clinical_study.official_title: Intraocular Pressure and Optic Nerve Sheath Diameter Changes in Laparoscopic Cholecystectomies

brief_summary.textblock: Pneumoperitoneum created during laparoscopic surgeries has some effects on human physiology. Increased intraabdominal pressure results in increased intrathoracic pressure, and eventually may result in increased intracranial and intraocular pressures. In this study we aimed to identify intraocular and intracranial pressure changes during the perioperative period due to the pneumoperitoneum created for laparoscopic cholecystectomy surgeries. Intraocular pressure will be measured directly from the eye. Intracranial pressure will be estimated by measuring optic nerve sheath diameter changes ultrasonographically.

primary_outcome.description: The normal physiological value for intraocular pressure is 10-20 mm Hg. It is affected by pneumoperitoneum created for laparoscopy. The pressure will be measured via ocular tonometry through the eye during the surgery at predetermined time intervals.

secondary_outcome.description: The normal physiological value for intracranial pressure is below 10 mm Hg. It is affected by pneumoperitoneum created for laparoscopy. The pressure will be estimated through changes in the optic nerve sheath diameter which will be measured by ultrasonography through the eye during the surgery at predetermined time intervals.

intervention.intervention_name: Intraocular pressure measurement via ocular tonometry
intervention.description: Intraocular pressure and optic nerve sheath diameter changes of the patients undergoing laparoscopic cholecystectomy will be measured throughout the surgery at different times using ocular tonometry and ultrasound, respectively.
intervention.other_name: Optic nerve sheath diameter measurement via ultrasound

study_pop.textblock: The study population will be ASA 1 or 2 physical status patients undergoing elective laparoscopic cholecystectomy.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients undergoing laparoscopic cholecystectomy
- American Society of Anesthesiologists (ASA) 1 or 2 physical status patients
- Elective surgeries
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with glaucoma
- ASA 3 or above patients
- Emergency surgeries

overall_official.affiliation: Marmara University School of Medicine, Dep of Anesthesiology and Reanimation
